commits.author: Adam Strzelecki
commits.summary: Color Picker: Lowercase output on lowercase input
commits.body:
If user uses lowercase CSS color notation, i.e. #fff then probably wants
lowercase output as well. Try to detect that.

commits.author: Adam Strzelecki
commits.body: Previously #fff or #fafafa were not detected as valid CSS color entries.

commits.author: Michael Sheets
commits.summary: Changes due to the way 2.0 returns word input
commits.body: 2.0 can return surrounding punctation as the word input when there is no preexisting color, workaround this by replacing the input only if it is a valid color.

commits.author: Stefan Daschek
commits.summary: Grammar: Match CSS 3 property names and vendor prefixes
commits.body:
Taken from SCSS bundle: https://github.com/MarioRicalde/SCSS.tmbundle/blob/ed7b0310682603a856a646a2db2dbcf3787cedb0/Syntaxes/SCSS.tmLanguage#L1570

There is a comment in the SCSS bundle “Reversal order is important; KEEP IT” – so I kept it :-)

However, I removed the “…|[0-9]{1,3}\%|…” part from the regex, because I think it doesn't belong here (it matches percent values, not property names).
